name: Red Trigger
description: Red Trigger is a First Person Shooter (FPS) Puzzle game. Can you infiltrate and corrupt the system?

reviews.review_text: This is a great little puzzler. The game's not long (one of the achievements is 'beat the game in under 10 minutes'), but for its price tag of exactly zero Botswana pulas, it's a good way to waste a few minutes.  There are a few bugs, though. While playing it I found that, if you jump and sprint at the same time on a pillar extending upwards, you fly ~5x as high, allowing you to bypass entire levels.

This game could be used as means of relaxing your mind. The art style is the biggest seller for me. I find a profound pleasure in running through this world from one point to the other. It is just amazing. The gameplay is very simple and can be picked up immediately. I hope the developer gets funded and publishes are more fuller game. It is a work in progress, do support him.

This is a very nice first-person platforming game. Really neat ideas and the UT4 engine seems to be a good choice for this one. But because its an Unreal engine, I was able to abuse the raising platforms, by just timing a jump properly. Its to bad that this game is rather on the short side, because I had a lot of fun playing this.  If you like Kreedz climbing or Defragging in Quake, you won't be dissapointed by checking out this one. Also check out a rather recently released game called 'Climbtime'.

This is not the game to play if you are looking for a very in depth story about taking down a corrupt system from the inside out. This is not the next Portal or any number of puzzle platformers. However, this is a nice little game that knows what its main mechanics are and utilizes them. I completed the game in about 10 minutes. So while not very long by any means it made me think for the short while that I was playing. Possible in a couple months I could come back and replay it fresh without quite remembering how to solve each of the eight levels.  So to summarize, very small game with few mechanics, but those mechanics are done well. Good pickup for someone just wanting a small puzzle game with a little bit of action. And it's free, what's the harm?

Tl;dr:  If you enjoy FPS puzzle games such as the Portal series you’ll more than likely have fun playing Red Trigger. It’s simple, it’s short, and it’s FREE!  Long(er) Review:  Red Trigger is a fun little puzzle game you can complete in under an hour at your leisure. There’s not much of a story to it, however it provides sufficient entertainment with the puzzles you need to solve to advance levels. The puzzles themselves are not overly complex but they do require problem solving therefore the general rhythm of game progression is nicely balanced and smooth. The visuals are interesting though perhaps a bit tiring after a while with the bright white landscape causing somewhat of a strain in the eyes (at least for me), however it’s not too bothersome. Although it’s not on a similar level as the better known titles Portal and Portal 2 (due to the lack of a compelling story and extremely short duration) I do recommend Red Trigger to anyone who enjoys this genre as it accomplishes what any self-respecting video game should: provide entertainment. Did I already mention that it’s free?
